subject: Communication
title: Forgiveness as a Resolution Tool
description: A micro-lesson that makes Forgiveness as a Resolution Tool usable.

hook.text: Forgiveness isn't about the other person. It's about freeing yourself from carrying the weight of resentment.

buildup.text: Research shows that holding grudges raises cortisol, blood pressure, and anxiety. Forgiveness reverses all three.

discovery.text: Forgiveness doesn't mean forgetting or condoning. It means releasing the emotional grip the conflict has on you.

twist.text: Studies show forgiving is harder for minor slights than major ones. Small resentments accumulate silently.

climax.text: Therapeutic forgiveness follows steps: acknowledge the hurt, decide to forgive, work through emotions, release.

punchline.text: Forgiveness isn't weakness. It's choosing freedom over resentment.

quiz.question: What does forgiveness in conflict resolution NOT mean?
